intro: Eremogone fendleri, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Eremogone fendleri plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
